results:
Based on the search results, I can provide information about the famous quotes from "Pan Tadeusz" by Adam Mickiewicz and its connection to the Polish thirteen-syllable verse (trzynastozgłoskowiec).

## "Pan Tadeusz" and Its Most Famous Quote

The national epic "Pan Tadeusz" by Adam Mickiewicz begins with an invocation.(no content)The invocation starts with an address to the homeland: "Litwo! Ojczyzno moja!" (Lithuania! My homeland!).

The most famous quote from the work is the opening lines:

"Litwo ojczyzno moja! ty jesteś jak zdrowie; Ile cię trzeba cenić, ten tylko się dowie, Kto cię stracił. Dziś piękność twą w całej ozdobie Widzę i opisuję, bo tęsknię po tobie."

(Lithuania, my homeland! You are like health; How much you need to be valued, only he will learn who has lost you. Today I see and describe your beauty in all its splendor, because I long for you.)

## Literary and Historical Context

Mickiewicz began work on "Pan Tadeusz" around 1832 and completed it in 1834.(no content)The work was written in Paris, where Mickiewicz lived after the defeat of the November Uprising.(no content)The novel, written in verse, is a kind of epic poem that crowns the Romantic period in Polish literature.(no content)The invocation contains the motif of health, which a person appreciates only when they lose it, and also references Jan Kochanowski's epigram "Na zdrowie" (On Health).(no content)In the invocation, the theme of the entire work is announced - it will be a story about the homeland.

The work is written in the Polish thirteen-syllable verse (trzynastozgłoskowiec), which was a traditional meter used in Polish epic poetry and gave the work its solemn, ceremonial character fitting for a national epic.
